result.execSummary:
The defendant Abel Bravo Lozoya was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted a payment plan of $100.00 per month to begin 09/10/2016

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abel Bravo Lozoya

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Richard R. Lewis and Defendant, Abel Bravo Lozoya appeared, pro se  Susan Rascon previously sworn as interpreter.  Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy

Pre-trial conference on August 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 11, 2016 at 01:20 pm.

The defendant shall have no contact with R.M.N. or J.F.M.G. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.    Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.

Prosecutor Richard R. Lewis and Defendant, Abel Bravo Lozoya appeared, pro se  Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 01:20 pm.
